moves.1. e4 c5 2. f4: the Morra Gambit lines: just, what I prefer to play with White; so my answer is ready...
moves.2... g6 3. Nf3 Bg7 4. Bc4: the best way, to castle fast: but not the best move...
moves.4... e6 5. O-O Ne7 6. c3: taking it too slow: preparing d4, is loss of tempo...
moves.10... O-O 11. b4 b5: both of Whites' Bishops are virually dead meat: White has to try something...
moves.12. a4 Bb7 13. axb5 axb5 14. Na3 Bc6: of course, Nxb5, Rxa1, poses no real threat for Black: this gives time, to complicate matters...
moves.33. Nc2 Bd7 34. Ne3 Be6: this is going to be a tough one: but far from a draw for both...
moves.37... Kg6 38. g4 hxg4+ 39. Kf4: a strange decision: but after Nxg4, things become unclear; there is still the matter of an escaping c-pawn...
moves.40. Bf6: this was what Black was planning: tying up the Black pieces; but Black still has one move left...
moves.41... g2 42. Nxg2 c2 43. Bg5 Nxg5: realizing, what he has done, White resigned...
